place.name: PENRHYDD
place.gazetteerText: PENRITH, or Penrhydd, a parish in the district of Newcastle-Emlyn and county of Pembroke; under Vrenin-vawr mountain, 7 miles S W of Newcastle-Emlyn r. station. It includes the chapelry of Castellan; and its post town is Cardigan. Acres, 3,081. Real property, £1, 245. Pop., 370. Houses, 93. The living is a rectory in the diocese of St. Davids. Value, £100. Patron, the Lord Chancellor. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
